extendedIngredients.name: arugula leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup arugula leaves, torn into pieces

extendedIngredients.name: figs
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ripe figs, quartered through the stem end

title: Mesclun, Arugula And Fennel Salad With Prosciutto And Pear Vina
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Mesclun, Arugulan And Fennel Salad With Prosciutto And Pear Vinan a try. One serving contains 35 calories, 1g of protein, and 2g of fat. For 45 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 20. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free diet. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of arugula leaves, pear nectar, mesclun salad greens, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 6 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 12%, this dish is rather bad. Try Warm Whole Grain Salad With Fennel, Arugula, Prosciutto, and Pecorino, Poached Pear Salad With Arugula, Prosciutto And Parmesan, and Roasted Baby Beets And Arugula Salad With Lemon-gorgonzola Vina for similar recipes.
instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the pear nectar and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Set the dressing aside.Cut off the stems and feathery tops and any bruised outer stalks from the fennel bulb. Cut the fennel bulb in half lengthwise and cut away and discard the core. Slice crosswise paper-thin. Set aside.In a bowl, combine the mesclun and arugula. Add half of the dressing and toss well. Divide the greens evenly among individual plates. Top the greens with the fennel, prosciutto and figs and drizzle with the remaining dressing. Using a cheese plane or a vegetable peeler, shave thin slices from the cheese and sprinkle over the salads. Season with pepper and serve.

steps.step: In a small bowl, stir together the pear nectar and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Set the dressing aside.
Cut off the stems and feathery tops and any bruised outer stalks from the fennel bulb.
Cut the fennel bulb in half lengthwise and cut away and discard the core. Slice crosswise paper-thin. Set aside.In a bowl, combine the mesclun and arugula.

Add half of the dressing and toss well. Divide the greens evenly among individual plates. Top the greens with the fennel, prosciutto and figs and drizzle with the remaining dressing. Using a cheese plane or a vegetable peeler, shave thin slices from the cheese and sprinkle over the salads. Season with pepper and serve.
